intro: Cladobium costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican cladobium, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in the summer months. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
